intro: Rhododendron daphniflorum, commonly known as the snowbell rhododendron, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its floral display. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Rhododendron daphniflorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
